text: Hirtella pauciflora is a species of plant in the family Chrysobalanaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. The specific epithet pauciflora is Latin for 'few- flowered'.Allen J. Coombes D. Gledhill ==References== pauciflora Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Hirtella pauciflora
